term.kTAG_DEFINITION: The local identifier uniquely identifies an object within a specific domain or namespace. The value is by definition a string.
The global identifier uniquely identifies the object across domains and namespaces. The value is by definition a string.
The unique identifier is a coded value that uniquely identifies an object in a container. This value will generally be a hashed string.

The synonyms or alternate identifiers are a list of strings by which an object is referenced. This attribute is used to record all the identifiers which are not present in the ontology; these strings are not related to languages.
The category is an enumerated set of values which represent the various categories to which an object belongs. The category is unrelated to the class of the object.
The kind is an enumerated set of values which represent the various types of the referencing object. The kind is specific to the class of the object.
The type is an enumerated set of values which represent the various types of the referenced object. The type applies to the referenced object and is used almost wxclusively to indicate the data type.
The class represents the object's class name, it is generally used for instantiating the correct class once an object has been retrieved from its container.

The namespace is a reference to a term which represents a container for a set of other term identifiers. Namespaces are used for grouping terms based on their functionality or to allow homonym identifiers.
The label is a string which represents the name or short description of an object. It is a structure which stores labels expressed in different languages.
The definition is the description of an object independent from its context. It is a structure which stores definitions expressed in different languages.
The description is the definition of an object dependent on its context. It is a structure which stores descriptions expressed in different languages.
The notes or comments provide additional information unrelated to the definition or description. It is a structure which stores notes expressed in different languages.
The examples or templates are a list of strings which represent use-cases. These strings are not in any specific language.

The severity or status level, is an element of an enumerated set which indicates the importance or severity of an event. The attribute must be one of the following values:
  • 0: Idle. This code indicates no errors, this state can be equated to an idle state.
  • 10: Notice. This code indicates a notice. A notice is an informative message that does not imply an error, nor a situation that should be handled; it can be considered as statistical data.
  • 20: Message. This code indicates a message. A message is an informative message that is addressed to somebody, although it does not imply an error or warning, it was issued to a receiving party.
  • 30: Warning. This code indicates a warning. Warnings are informative data that indicate a potential problem, although they do not imply an error, they indicate a potential problem or an issue that should be addressed at least at a later stage.
  • 40: Error. This code indicates an error. Errors indicate that something prevented an operation from being performed, this does not necessarily mean that the whole process is halted, but that the results of an operation will not be as expected.
  • 50: Fatal. This code indicates a fatal error. Fatal errors are errors that result in stopping the whole process: in this case the error will prevent other operations from being performed and the whole process should be halted.
  • 60: Bug. This code indicates a bug. Bugs, as opposed to errors, result from internal causes independant from external factors. A bug indicates that an operation will never execute as stated, it does not necessarily mean that it is fatal, but rather that the behaviour of an operation does not correspond to its declaration.
The status code is an element of an enumerated set which indicates the specific state of the event.
The status message is a string that describes the status of an event. It is a structure which stores messages expressed in different languages.
It is a list of author names.
It is a list of generic acknowledgments.
It is a list of bibliographic references.
It is a reference to a term.
It is a reference to a node.
It is the subject of a relationship, or the vertex from which a relationship originates.
It is the object of a relationship, or the vertex to which the relationship points.
It is the term which relates the subject and object of a relationship.
It is the sequence of vertex, predicate and vertex elements which connect an origin vertex to a destination vertex.
It is an integer attribute which counts how many times a term was referenced as a namespace.
It is an collection of node references.
It is an collection of edge references.
It is an collection of feature references, references to objects that have referenced the current object as a feature or trait.
It is an collection of method references, references to objects that have referenced the current object as a method or modifier.
It is an collection of scale references, references to objects that have referenced the current object as a scale or unit.
